trans-unit.source: Access SharePoint on behalf of the user | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Access SharePoint on behalf of the user | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to make calls to SharePoint on behalf of the user
trans-unit.target: Learn how to make calls to SharePoint on behalf of the user

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to access the SharePoint APIs on behalf of the currently logged-in user.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to access the SharePoint APIs on behalf of the currently logged-in user.

trans-unit.source: If you prefer to watch a video, the clip to the right follows the same steps as this tutorial. In the video, Mat Velloso walks you through updating a Windows Store app to interact with SharePoint Online.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer to watch a video, the clip to the right follows the same steps as this tutorial. In the video, Mat Velloso walks you through updating a Windows Store app to interact with SharePoint Online.

trans-unit.source: watch the tutorial
trans-unit.target: watch the tutorial

trans-unit.source: Play Video
trans-unit.target: Play Video

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will update the app from the Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On tutorial to create a Word document in SharePoint Online when a new TodoItem is added.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will update the app from the Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On tutorial to create a Word document in SharePoint Online when a new TodoItem is added.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable on-behalf-of access to SharePoint:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable on-behalf-of access to SharePoint:

trans-unit.source: [Register your application for delegated access to SharePoint]
trans-unit.target: [Register your application for delegated access to SharePoint]

trans-unit.source: [Add SharePoint information to your mobile service]
trans-unit.target: [Add SharePoint information to your mobile service]

trans-unit.source: [Obtain an access token and call the SharePoint API]
trans-unit.target: [Obtain an access token and call the SharePoint API]

trans-unit.source: [Create and upload a Word document]
trans-unit.target: [Create and upload a Word document]

trans-unit.source: [Test the application]
trans-unit.target: [Test the application]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 running on Windows 8.1
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 running on Windows 8.1

trans-unit.source: An active [SharePoint Online] subscription
trans-unit.target: An active [SharePoint Online] subscription

trans-unit.source: Completion of the [Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Completion of the [Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: You should use the tenant provided by your SharePoint subscription.
trans-unit.target: You should use the tenant provided by your SharePoint subscription.

trans-unit.source: By default, the token you receive from AAD has limited permissions.
trans-unit.target: By default, the token you receive from AAD has limited permissions.

trans-unit.source: In order to access a third-party resource or SaaS application such as SharePoint Online, you must explicitly allow it.
trans-unit.target: In order to access a third-party resource or SaaS application such as SharePoint Online, you must explicitly allow it.

trans-unit.source: In the Active Directory Section of the [Azure Management Portal], select your tenant.
trans-unit.target: In the Active Directory Section of the [Azure Management Portal], select your tenant.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the web application that you created for the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the web application that you created for the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the Configure tab, scroll the page down to the permissions to other applications section.
trans-unit.target: In the Configure tab, scroll the page down to the permissions to other applications section.

trans-unit.source: Select Office 365 SharePoint Online and grant the Edit or delete users' files delegated permission.
trans-unit.target: Select Office 365 SharePoint Online and grant the Edit or delete users' files delegated permission.

trans-unit.source: Then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Then click Save.

trans-unit.source: You have now configured AAD to issue a SharePoint access token to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: You have now configured AAD to issue a SharePoint access token to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In order to make a call to SharePoint, you need to specify the endpoints that the mobile service needs to talk to.
trans-unit.target: In order to make a call to SharePoint, you need to specify the endpoints that the mobile service needs to talk to.

trans-unit.source: You also need to be able to prove the identity of your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: You also need to be able to prove the identity of your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This is accomplished using a Client ID and Client Secret pair.
trans-unit.target: This is accomplished using a Client ID and Client Secret pair.

trans-unit.source: You have already obtained and stored the Client ID for the mobile service during the AAD login setup.
trans-unit.target: You have already obtained and stored the Client ID for the mobile service during the AAD login setup.

trans-unit.source: Because these are sensitive credentials, you should not store them as plaintext in our code.
trans-unit.target: Because these are sensitive credentials, you should not store them as plaintext in our code.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you will set these values as Application Settings for our Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you will set these values as Application Settings for our Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: Return to the AAD Applications tab for your tenant, and select the web application for your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Return to the AAD Applications tab for your tenant, and select the web application for your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Under Configure, scroll down to Keys.
trans-unit.target: Under Configure, scroll down to Keys.

trans-unit.source: You will obtain a Client Secret by generating a new key.
trans-unit.target: You will obtain a Client Secret by generating a new key.

trans-unit.source: Note once you create a key and leave the page, there is no way to get it out of the portal again.
trans-unit.target: Note once you create a key and leave the page, there is no way to get it out of the portal again.

trans-unit.source: Upon creation you must copy and save this value in a secure location.
trans-unit.target: Upon creation you must copy and save this value in a secure location.

trans-unit.source: Select a duration for your key, then click save, and copy out the resulting value.
trans-unit.target: Select a duration for your key, then click save, and copy out the resulting value.

trans-unit.source: In the Mobile Services section of the Management Portal, navigate to the Configure tab, and scroll down to App Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the Mobile Services section of the Management Portal, navigate to the Configure tab, and scroll down to App Settings.

trans-unit.source: Here you can provide a key-value pair to help you reference the necessary credentials.
trans-unit.target: Here you can provide a key-value pair to help you reference the necessary credentials.

trans-unit.source: Set SP_Authority to be the authority endpoint for your AAD tenant.
trans-unit.target: Set SP_Authority to be the authority endpoint for your AAD tenant.

trans-unit.source: This should be the same as the authority value used for your client app.
trans-unit.target: This should be the same as the authority value used for your client app.

trans-unit.source: It will be of the form https://login.windows.net/contoso.onmicrosoft.com
trans-unit.target: It will be of the form https://login.windows.net/contoso.onmicrosoft.com

trans-unit.source: Set SP_ClientSecret to be the client secret value you obtained earlier.
trans-unit.target: Set SP_ClientSecret to be the client secret value you obtained earlier.

trans-unit.source: Set SP_SharePointURL to be the URL for your SharePoint site.
trans-unit.target: Set SP_SharePointURL to be the URL for your SharePoint site.

trans-unit.source: It should be of the form https://contoso-my.sharepoint.com
trans-unit.target: It should be of the form https://contoso-my.sharepoint.com

trans-unit.source: You will be able to obtain these values again in our code using ApiServices.Settings.
trans-unit.target: You will be able to obtain these values again in our code using ApiServices.Settings.

trans-unit.source: In order to access SharePoint, you need a special access token with SharePoint as the target audience.
trans-unit.target: In order to access SharePoint, you need a special access token with SharePoint as the target audience.

trans-unit.source: To get this token, you will need to call back into AAD with the identity of the Mobile Service and the token that was issued for the user.
trans-unit.target: To get this token, you will need to call back into AAD with the identity of the Mobile Service and the token that was issued for the user.

trans-unit.source: Open your Mobile Services backend project in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open your Mobile Services backend project in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: In your Mobile Services backend project, crate a new class called SharePointUploadContext.
trans-unit.target: In your Mobile Services backend project, crate a new class called SharePointUploadContext.

trans-unit.source: In it, add the following:
trans-unit.target: In it, add the following:

trans-unit.source: Now create a method to add the file to the user's document library:
trans-unit.target: Now create a method to add the file to the user's document library:

trans-unit.source: To create a Word document, you will use the OpenXML NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: To create a Word document, you will use the OpenXML NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: Install this package by opening the NuGet Manager and searching for DocumentFormat.OpenXml.
trans-unit.target: Install this package by opening the NuGet Manager and searching for DocumentFormat.OpenXml.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to TodoItemController.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to TodoItemController.

trans-unit.source: This will create a Word document based on a TodoItem.
trans-unit.target: This will create a Word document based on a TodoItem.

trans-unit.source: The text of the document will be the name of the item.
trans-unit.target: The text of the document will be the name of the item.

trans-unit.source: Replace PostTodoItem with the following:
trans-unit.target: Replace PostTodoItem with the following:

trans-unit.source: Publish the changes to the backend, and then run your client application.
trans-unit.target: Publish the changes to the backend, and then run your client application.

trans-unit.source: Log in when prompted, and insert a new TodoItem.
trans-unit.target: Log in when prompted, and insert a new TodoItem.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your SharePoint site and log in with the same user.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your SharePoint site and log in with the same user.

trans-unit.source: Select the OneDrive tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the OneDrive tab.

trans-unit.source: Under the Documents Folder, you should see a Word document with a GUID title.
trans-unit.target: Under the Documents Folder, you should see a Word document with a GUID title.

trans-unit.source: When you open it, you should find the text for your TodoItem.
trans-unit.target: When you open it, you should find the text for your TodoItem.
